data.description: Kdump auto crashkernel reservation failed because the total memory does not meet the minimum requirement
data.summary: Kdump fails to collect vmcore when the reserved size does not meet the minimum requirement.
data.generic: Automatic reservation did not work because the total memory does not meet the minimum requirement for kdump.

resolution_set.resolution:
Red Hat recommends that you change the **crashkernel** setting in the `grub.conf` file.

{{?pydata.error_key == "CRASHKERNEL_RECOMMENDED_VALUE_V2"}}
1. Update the value of the **"crashkernel"** kernel parameter:
  ~~~
  # grubby --update-kernel=ALL --args=crashkernel={{=pydata.value[2]}}M
  ~~~
1. Reboot the system:
  ~~~
  # reboot
  ~~~
{{?}}


{{?pydata.error_key == "CRASHKERNEL_AUTO_FAILURE_V2"}}
1. Update the value of the **"crashkernel"** kernel parameter:
  ~~~
  # grubby --update-kernel=ALL --args=crashkernel={{=pydata.value[1]}}M
  ~~~
1. Reboot the system:
  ~~~
  # reboot
  ~~~
{{?}}


After applying the remediation, refresh the results of Advisor analysis by running the `insights-client` command on the system. 
~~~ 
# insights-client 
~~~
